feed.title: Baumwelt
feed.subtitle: Baumwelt is a landscape architecture firm located in Tacoma, Washington. We are powered by inspired individuals who seek a better world for all.

entry.title: Introducing Our New Logo
entry.content:
As part of our recent rebrand, we’re excited to unveil a new logo that captures the spirit and vision of our practice. At its core, the circular form suggests a horizon—a rising or setting sun—drawing the eye inward and evoking a sense of place and atmosphere. The blue palette nods to the “blue planet,” grounding our work in environmental awareness and global context.

The abstract form can also be read as a tree in plan view, merging natural systems with design thinking. A surrounding orbital band hints at movement and unity—representing the interconnectedness of landscape, ecology, and people.

In another light, the logo is seen as a creative “big bang”—a burst of energy symbolizing growth, imagination, and the powerful momentum behind every landscape we shape.
entry.summary: We are excited to unveil our new logo capturing the spirit and vision of our practice.

entry.title: Penmet Minigolf
entry.content:
We’re thrilled to share a sneak peek of the first shipment of themed features arriving for the new minigolf course at PenMet Parks headquarters. This renovation embraces the spirit of the Pacific Northwest—including its landscapes, aquatic ecosystems, maritime culture, and folklore—with playful, hand-crafted elements designed to delight visitors of all ages.

Loaded up and ready for installation, the truck carries an exciting cast of characters and landmarks: two orcas, snow-capped mountains, a lighthouse, a ferry, a steam donkey, seals, salmon, and yes—even Bigfoot.

Stay tuned for more behind-the-scenes updates as this one-of-a-kind course comes to life!
entry.summary: First shipment arrives at PenMet Parks Minigolf Course.

entry.title: Spring Update
entry.content:
As spring takes hold in the Pacific Northwest, a new season of landscape design is underway at a private lakeside villa in Pierce County. A centerpiece of the project—a mature olive tree sourced from a century-old orchard in Northern California—continues to thrive after its careful relocation last year.

Personally selected by the owner for its character and provenance, the tree was studied in detail to ensure it could adapt to the Northwest’s unique climate. Now settled into its new home, it reinforces the project’s vision of evoking the timeless feel of the Italian countryside.

entry.title: Banana
entry.content:
A banana is an edible fruit – botanically a berry – produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musa.

In some countries, bananas used for cooking may be called “plantains”, distinguishing them from dessert bananas. The fruit is variable in size, color, and firmness, but is usually elongated and curved, with soft flesh rich in starch covered with a rind, which may be green, yellow, red, purple, or brown when ripe.
entry.summary: A banana is an edible fruit – botanically a berry – produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musa.

entry.title: Apple
entry.content:
An apple is a sweet, edible fruit produced by an apple tree.

Apple trees are cultivated worldwide, and are the most widely grown species in the genus Malus. The tree originated in Central Asia, where its wild ancestor, Malus sieversii, is still found today. Apples have been grown for thousands of years in Asia and Europe, and were brought to North America by European colonists.
entry.summary: An apple is a sweet, edible fruit produced by an apple tree.

entry.title: Kiwi
entry.content:
Kiwifruit (often abbreviated as kiwi), or Chinese gooseberry is the edible berry of several species of woody vines in the genus Actinidia.

The most common cultivar group of kiwifruit is oval, about the size of a large hen’s egg (5–8 cm (2.0–3.1 inches) in length and 4.5–5.5 cm (1.8–2.2 inches) in diameter). It has a fibrous, dull greenish-brown skin and bright green or golden flesh with rows of tiny, black, edible seeds. The fruit has a soft texture, with a sweet and unique flavor.
entry.summary: Kiwifruit (often abbreviated as kiwi), or Chinese gooseberry is the edible berry of several species of woody vines in the genus Actinidia.
